titles.title: To direct the Securities and Exchange Commission to allow certain issuers to be exempt from registration requirements, and for other purposes.
Improving Access to Capital Act
Improving Access to Capital Act
Improving Access to Capital Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 59 - 0.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Financial Services. H. Rept. 115-292.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 210.

action.text: Mr. Hultgren moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2864.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 403 - 3 (Roll no. 440).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: (Sec. 1) This bill exempts, under Regulation A+, certain fully reporting issuers of securities from specified disclosure requirements. Under current law, Regulation A+ exempts certain smaller offerings from securities registration requirements but applies only to non-reporting issuers.
